sen.j: 菅原（すがわら）氏は、日本の古代から近世までの貴族。
sen.e: The Sugawara clan was a noble family that existed from ancient to early-modern times of Japan.
The Sugawara clan was a noble family that existed from ancient to early-modern times in Japan.
The Sugawara clan was a noble family that existed from ancient to early-modern times in Japan.

sen.j: 天穂日命の子孫で、大相撲の祖として知られる野見宿禰を先祖とする土師氏の子孫。
sen.e: The Sugawara clan, the posterity of Ameno Hohino Mikoto, was descended from the Haji clan whose ancester was NOMI no Sukune known as the pioneer of Japanese sumo.
The Sugawara clan is said to be descended from Ameno Hohino Mikoto and the Haji clan, one of whose ancestors was NOMI no Sukune, famous as the pioneer of Sumo.
sen.cmt: Not sure what is meant by "the posterity of". I think descendent is OK here. Don't need "Japanese Sumo."
sen.e: The Sugawara clan is said to be descended from Ameno Hohino Mikoto and the Haji clan, one of whose ancestors was Nomi no Sukune, famous as the pioneer of Sumo.

sen.j: ただし土師氏そして菅原氏を渡来人系の氏族とする説もある。
sen.e: However, some say that the Haji and the Sugawara clans were toraijin (people from the continent) families.
Another view is that the Haji and the Sugawara clans were toraijin (people from the continent).
Another view is that the Haji and the Sugawara clans were toraijin (people from the continent).

sen.j: 平安時代初期の菅原古人が大和国菅原邑に住んでいたことから、以降、菅原氏を名乗る。
sen.e: The clan had taken the name of Sugawara since SUGAWARA no Furuhito lived in Sugawara village, the Province of Yamato in the early Heian period.
The name Sugawara comes from Sugawara in the Province of Yamato where (SUGAWARA no) Furuhito lived in the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: I think it is better to make Sugawara the subject, and thus reworked the sentence accordingly.
sen.e: The name Sugawara comes from Sugawara in Yamato Province where (SUGAWARA no) Furuhito lived in the early Heian period.

sen.j: また、当時絶大な力を持っていた藤原氏のライバルであったと伝えられている。
sen.e: The Sugawara clan was identified as a rival for the Fujiwara clan which had enormous power at the time.
The Sugawara clan was a rival to the Fujiwara clan which had enormous power in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: It is not clear what time "at that time" is referring to. I have used "in ancient Japan" but a more specific description may be required.
sen.e: The Sugawara clan was a rival to the Fujiwara clan which had enormous power in ancient Japan.

sen.j: 菅原古人の子菅原清公（770年～842年）（従三位・非参議）、および孫の菅原是善（812年～880年）（従三位・参議）を含め、大江氏と並んで子孫は代々、紀伝道（文章道）を家業として朝廷に仕える。
sen.e: The descendants, such as SUGAWARA no Furuhito's son, SUGAWARA no Kiyokimi (770-842) (Junior Third Cout Rank, non-Councilor), and his grandson, SUGAWARA no Koreyoshi (812-880) (Junior Third Court Rank, Councilor), served the Court for generations with the Oe clan carying on the house business of Kidendo (Literature).

Together with the Oe clan, SUGIWARA no Furohito's descendants, including his son, SUGAWARA no Kiyokimi (770-842) (Junior Third Cout Rank, non-Councilor), and his grandson, SUGAWARA no Koreyoshi (812-880) (Junior Third Court Rank, Councilor), served the Court for generations, working in the field of Kidendo (Literature).
sen.cmt: Reworked the sentence to make it read better.
sen.e: Together with the Oe clan, Sugawara no Furuhito's descendants, including his son, Sugawara no Kiyokimi (770-842) (Junior Third Rank, non-Councilor), and his grandson, Sugawara no Koreyoshi (812-880) (Junior Third Rank, Councilor), served the Court for generations, working in the field of Kidendo (Literature).
sen.cmt: SUGIWARA no Furohito→Sugawara no Furuhito, cout→court"Junior Third Court Rank" -> "Junior Third Rank" に変更しました。

sen.j: 歴代菅原氏の人物の中で特に有名なのは是善の子菅原道真である。
sen.e: Among the successive members of the Sugawara clan, the most prominent figure was SUGAWARA no Michizane, Koreyoshi's son.
One of the most famous members of the Sugawara clan was SUGAWARA no Michizane, Koreyoshi's son.
sen.cmt: This is a slight simplification, but I think the "successive" meaning is implicit
sen.e: One of the most famous members of the Sugawara clan was Sugawara no Michizane, Koreyoshi's son.

sen.j: 彼は阿衡事件で藤原基経を諌めた事をきっかけに宇多天皇の抜擢を受け、次の醍醐天皇の治世に従二位・右大臣に至るが、901年、藤原時平の讒言により大宰権帥に左遷され、903年、大宰府にて薨去。
sen.e: After the Ako Incident where he protested against FUJIWARA no Mototsune, he was selected by Emperor Uda, and reached the position of the Junior Second Court Rank, Minister of the Right during the reign of Emperor Daigo, but in 901, he was slandered by FUJIWARA no Tokihira, demoted to the Dazai-no-Gonnosotsu, Deputy Governor of Dazaifu, and ended up dying in Dazaifu in 903.

After speaking out against FUJIWARA no Mototsune in the Ako Incident, he was favored by Emperor Uda and reached the position of Minister of the Right, Junior Second Court Rank, during the reign of Emperor Daigo, but he was slandered by FUJIWARA no Tokihira, demoted to the Dazai-no-Gonnosotsu, Deputy Governor of Dazaifu in 901, and died there in 903.
sen.cmt: "Minister of the Right, Junior Second Court Rank" is the more logical way to write this post. i.e. postion followed by rank.
sen.e: After speaking out against Fujiwara no Mototsune in the Ako Incident, he was favored by the Emperor Uda and reached the position of Minister of the Right, Junior Second Rank, during the reign of the Emperor Daigo, but he was slandered by Fujiwara no Tokihira, demoted to the Dazai-no-Gonnosotsu, Deputy Governor of Dazaifu in 901, and died there in 903.
sen.cmt: FUJIWARA→Fujiwara"the" を挿入しました。"Junior Second Court Rank" -> "Junior Second Rank" に変更しました。

sen.j: しかし、菅原道真の死後、相次ぐ天変地異や、道真を左遷に追い込んだ藤原時平の子孫たちの相次ぐ急死、更には930年の清涼殿落雷事件による醍醐天皇崩御等という凶事を理由に、間もなく彼の子孫は朝廷に呼び戻された。
sen.e: However, after SUGAWARA no Michizane's death, tragic accidents occurred, such as a series of natural disasters happened, the descendants of FUJIWARA no Tokihira who degraded Michinaga died suddenly in succession, and Emperor Daigo passed away due to the Seiryo-Den thunderbolt striking incident in 930; thus, Michinaga's posterity was called back to the Court soon.

However, when SUGAWARA no Michizane's death was followed by a series of tragic accidents and natural disasters, with a number of descendants of FUJIWARA no Tokihira who had slandered Michinaga dying suddenly in succession and Emperor Daigo being killed in the Seiryo-Den lightening strike of 930, Michinaga's descendents were quickly called back to Court.
sen.cmt: 清涼殿落雷事件 is bettter translated as "Seiryo-Den lightening strike"
sen.e: However, when Sugawara no Michizane's death was followed by a series of tragic accidents and natural disasters, with a number of descendants of Fujiwara no Tokihira who had slandered Michinaga dying suddenly in succession and the Emperor Daigo being killed in the Seiryo-Den lightening strike of 930, Michinaga's descendents were quickly called back to Court.
sen.cmt: SUGAWARA→Sugawara, FUJIWARA→Fujiwara"the" を挿入しました。

sen.j: なお更級日記の原作者菅原孝標女は菅原道真の子菅原高視の子孫である。
sen.e: SUGAWARA no Takasue's daughter, the original writer of Sarashina-Diary was also a descendant of SUGAWARA no Takami, SUGAWARA no Michizane's son.
SUGAWARA no Takasue's daughter, the original author of the Sarashina-Diary was a descendant of SUGAWARA no Takami, SUGAWARA no Michizane's son.
Sugawara no Takasue's daughter, the original author of the Sarashina-Diary was a descendant of Sugawara no Takami, Sugawara no Michizane's son.

tit.cmt: 中世 is better as middle ages. Also 中世以降 includes the middle ages.

sen.j: 平安時代中後期は、一時、紀伝道の分野で大江氏に優位を奪われ、菅原文時（899年～981年）（従三位・非参議）、菅原輔正（925年～1009年）（位階・参議・大宰府）のような例外を除いて公卿に列せられることはなかったが、鎌倉時代初期の菅原為長（1158年～1246年）が正二位・参議・大蔵省に昇進して以降、子孫は累代公卿に列せられ、朝廷における紀伝道の要職を独占。
sen.e: During the middle and late Heian period, the Sugawara clan gave the Oe clan its dominant position in the field of Kidendo for a while, and as the result, members of the clan could not be ranked as the Court nobles except SUGAWARA no Fumitoki (899-981) (Junior Third Court Rank, non-Councilor) and SUGAWARA no Sukemasa (925-1009) (Court Rank, Councilor, Dazaifu, foreign affairs office in Kyushu), but since SUGAWARA no Tamenaga (1158-1246) was promoted to the Senior Second Court Rank, Councilor, Treasury Office, his descendants had been ranked as the Court nobles for generations, taking all important posts of Kidendo in the Court.

In the mid-to-late Heian period, the Sugawara clan was temporarily displaced from its dominant position in the field of Kidendo by the Oe clan and, as a result, and with the notable exceptions of SUGAWARA no Fumitoki (899-981) (Junior Third Court Rank, non-Councilor) and SUGAWARA no Sukemasa (925-1009) (Court Rank, Councilor, Dazaifu, foreign affairs office in Kyushu) members of the Sugawara clan were not ranked as Court nobles over this time, but at the beginning of the Kamakura period SUGAWARA no Tamenaga (1158-1246) was promoted to Senior Second Court Rank, Councilor, Treasury Office and his descendants were subsequently ranked as the Court nobles, taking all the important Kidendo posts at Court.
sen.cmt: Changed "gave" to "was.. Displaced" since the source text suggests that they did not take up the position voluntarily.
sen.e: In the mid-to-late Heian period, the Sugawara clan was temporarily displaced from its dominant position in the field of Kidendo by the Oe clan and, as a result, and with the notable exceptions of Sugawara no Fumitoki (899-981) (Junior Third Rank, non-Councilor) and Sugawara no Sukemasa (925-1009) (Court Rank, Councilor, Dazaifu, foreign affairs office in Kyushu), members of the Sugawara clan were not ranked as Court nobles over this time, but at the beginning of the Kamakura period Sugawara no Tamenaga (1158-1246) was promoted to Senior Second Court Rank, Councilor, Treasury Office and his descendants were subsequently ranked as Court nobles, taking all the important Kidendo posts at Court.
sen.cmt: 構文の間違いを修正。"Junior Third Court Rank" -> "Junior Third Rank" に変更しました。

sen.j: その後近世に至るまで高辻家、五条家、東坊城家、唐橋家、清岡家、桑原家の6家の堂上家を輩出するにいたる。
sen.e: Since then to early-modern times, the Sugawara clan produced the six houses of Tosho: the house of Takatsuji, the Gojyo, the Higashibojo, the Karahashi, the Kiyooka, and the Kuwabara.

Between that time and early-modern times, the Sugawara clan produced the six Houses of Tosho (families which were allowed to provide nobles), these being the houses of Takatsuji, Gojo, Higashibojo, Karahashi, Kiyooka, and Kuwabara.
sen.cmt: I have added "(families which were allowed to provide nobles)" to clarify what "Tosho" is.
sen.e: Between that time and early-modern times, the Sugawara clan produced the six Houses of Tosho (families which were allowed to provide nobles), these being the houses of Takatsuji, Gojo, Higashibojo, Karahashi, Kiyooka, and Kuwabara.

tit.j: 菅原姓を名乗った氏族（大名）
tit.e: The clans (daimyos) that took the name of Sugawara
The clans (daimyo) that took the name of Sugawara
tit.cmt: I don't think daimyo needs an "s" in the plural.
tit.e: The clans (daimyo) that took the name of Sugawara

sen.cmt: I think "disputed" is more natural than "a controversial issue".
I think "disputed" is more natural than "a controversial issue".
I think "disputed" is more natural than "a controversial issue".

sen.e: Explanatory note: actual sons indicated with heavy lines
Explanatory note: actual sons indicated with heavy lines
Explanatory note: biological sons indicated with heavy lines

sen.j: (なお養子はあえて記載せず。)
菅原高視 菅原淳茂 菅原衍子
sen.e: SUGAWARA no Takami SUGAWARA no Atsushige SUGAWARA no Enshi
SUGAWARA no Takami SUGAWARA no Atsushige SUGAWARA no Enshi
Sugawara no Takami Sugawara no Atsushige Sugawara no Enshi

sen.j: 菅原文時 菅原在躬
sen.e: SUGAWARA no Fumitoki SUGAWARA no Arimi
SUGAWARA no Fumitoki SUGAWARA no Arimi
Sugawara no Fumitoki Sugawara no Arimi

tit.j: 菅原氏の末裔とされる有名人
tit.e: Public figures identified as the descendants of the Sugawara clan
Public figures identified as the descendants of the Sugawara clan
Public figures identified as the descendants of the Sugawara clan

sen.cmt: I think that the "y" in "Jyu" can be omitted in standard romanization.
